summary: The 'Putting American Students First Act' amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish specific citizenship and residency requirements for individuals participating in Federal TRIO programs. It mandates that participants must be US nationals, lawfully admitted aliens, aliens with intent to become lawful permanent residents, citizens of or lawful residents of the Freely Associated States, or have CNMI Resident status. The bill also prohibits waivers of these requirements under existing laws.
